alert.note: Alert for Iredell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 8:30PM EDT until August 28 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Alexander and Iredell. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood-prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated 1-2 inches of rain has fallen across eastern Alexander County, with isolated totals approaching 2.5 inches. The slow-moving thunderstorm responsible for this rainfall is moving east into Iredell County near Stony Point and Scotts. Additionally, a separate thunderstorm cell has developed over east-central Iredell County between Statesville and Cool Springs. These storms will produce 1-3 inches of rainfall over portions of Iredell County and may impact the Statesville metro area as well over the next hour. This rainfall will cause significant rises on small streams with some streams exceeding bankfull. Nuisance to Minor flooding associated with these storms is imminent from Hiddenite to Scotts to Statesville and Cool Springs with new areas of flooding possible over the next 1-2 hours. The current areas of greatest concern currently across eastern Alexander County near and east of Hiddenite, including near Sharpe Mill Rd, Cheatham Ford Rd, Damascus Church Rd, and Pisgah Church Rd. Expect new areas of flooding to develop further east into Iredell County through 10pm. - Additional rainfall of 1-2 inches is possible over the next 60-90 minutes. A Flash Flood Warning may be needed if ongoing storms do not dissipate quickly enough Please stay weather aware and be prepared to seek higher ground if you are in an area vulnerable to flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Statesville, Troutman, Stony Point, Scotts, Turnersburg, Hiddenite, Cool Springs, Vashti and Millersville.
